about.formula_en: TIMI Risk Index = Heart Rate * (Age/10)2 / Systolic BP

Original/Primary Reference.text: Wiviott SD, Morrow DA, Frederick PD, Antman EM, Braunwald E; National Registry of Myocardial Infarction. Application of the Thrombolysis in Myocardial Infarction risk index in non-ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction: evaluation of patients in the National Registry of Myocardial Infarction. J Am Coll Cardiol. 2006 Apr 18;47(8):1553-8. Epub 2006 Mar 29. PubMed PMID: 16630990.

creator_info.about_en: Stephen D. Wiviott, MD, is an associate professor of cardiovascular medicine at Harvard Medical School. He is also a practicing physician in the Lown Cardiovascular Intensive Care Unit at Brigham and Women's Hospital in Massachusetts. Dr. Wiviott is a senior investigator in the TIMI Study Group and has published over 100 peer-reviewed articles and multiple chapters in major cardiovascular textbooks.

how_to_use.pearls_pitfalls_en: A simple calculator to predict 30-day mortality, which has been well validated against a registry of 150,000 STEMI patients, and shown to have a very good discriminatory capacity. It was also validated against a registry of over 300,000 NSTEMI patients. It has been shown to both predict in-hospital and long-term mortality.

next_steps.advice_en: Mortality estimates may be useful in determining the level of care and intensity of treatment.

medium_description_en: Provides mortality estimate in patients with ACS using only blood pressure, heart rate, and age.

seo.meta_description_en: The TIMI Risk Index provides mortality estimate in patients with ACS using only blood pressure, heart rate, and age.

related_calcs.short_title_en: Framingham Risk Score (Hard Coronary Heart Disease)
